question: 親友
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>friend</kanji> who is like one of your <kanji>parent</kanji>s is someone who will look out for you. They are like family, in fact! That's why this word means <vocabulary>best friend</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>close friend</vocabulary>. Just imagine someone who watches over you like a parent would. This is the way to describe them.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
